TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {7620=Sure, we're not exactly…sure what they're going to sing. But does it really matter? You don't need a designated title to a concert tour when two legends decide to do a mash-up of the marquee. All you need to know is that the idea for tour grew out of a show Sting and Simon played together in May 2013 where they performed everything from acoustic versions of "The Boxer" and "Fields of Sting" as duets., 7805=Paul Simon and Sting are about to share a stage together. Or should we say they will be, "On Stage Together," which is the official name of their 2014 tour., 3156=Paul Simon began his solo career with his self-titled album, and followed it up with the acclaimed album There Goes Rhymin' Simon. Shortly thereafter, Simon embarked on a solo tour, and Paul Simon tickets were a hot commodity. After 'Rhymin' Simon' came the highly anticipated Still Crazy After All These Years, which was released in late 1975. This album was darker than his previous work, but gained much critical acclaim. Once again, Paul Simon ticketssold quickly. Paul Simon has won more than ten Grammy Awards, and he also was awarded the first annual Gershwin Prize by the Library of Congress in 2007., 3980=Simon celebrated the 25th anniversary of his classic album "Graceland" with an African musical extravaganza in London on July 15, 2012. On September 18, he released a new two-CD, one-DVD package called "Paul Simon Live in New York City." It features his performance at Webster Hall on his 2011 U.S. tour., 9601=The 18-city tour will kick off Friday, March 13, 2015 in Krakow Poland, to be followed by performances in Prague, Berlin, Oslo, Stockholm, Amsterdam, Antwerp, Koln, Zurich, Munich, Milan, Vienna, Paris, Dublin, Glasgow, Birmingham, Manchester & London., 6890=Simon's tour will be briefly interrupted at the end of March, but for good reason. The Civil Wars' Joy Williams, soul singer Bettye LaVette and Husker Du's Bob Mould will lead a tribute to Simon set to take place at New York City's famed Carnegie Hall on March 31., 8998=The UK portion of the tour begins April 7 in Dublin at 3Arena before moving on to some other huge arenas – Glasgow's The SSE Hydro, Birmingham's LG Arena, Manchester's Phones 4U Arena and London's The O2., 3583=Paul Frederic Simon was born October 13, 1941 in Newark, New Jersey. Best known for his participation as part of the duo Simon & Garfunkel, Simon penned the majority of the group's songs, including three number one singles: 'The Sound of Silence', 'Mrs. Robinson', and 'Bridge Over Troubled Water'. The pair split in 1970, and Simon pursued a solo career., 4462=In 1999, Simon toured on a double bill with Bob Dylan while simultaneously working on his next album. "You're the One," bowed in October 2000, and his next collection of new material didn't come until "Surprise" in 2006. His twelfth studio album, "So Beautiful or So What" was released on April 8, 2011 and debuted at number four on the Billboard 200 – his highest debut on that chart in a career that has spanned well over 50 years., 5024=Simon's career renaissance continued in the 90's, as he took on the heady task of writing a Broadway stage musical. "The Capeman" opened at the Marquis Theatre in 1998, but received poor reviews and had an initial run of only 68 performances, blending doo-wop, gospel and Latin music. It still received a Tony award nomination for Best Original Score, and was resurrected and performed at both the Brooklyn Academy of Music and at the Beacon Theatre, along with a concert production of the musical at Central Park's Delacorte Theater., 1930=If you’ve ever wanted to enjoy some of the biggest names in music performing live and also help make a difference, then we know where you should be on January 20, 2015. That’s when the “The Nearness of You” benefit concert--with proceeds going to help fund both cancer AND myelodisplastic syndromes (MDS) research at the…, 5649=Simon, who became interested in (and obviously influenced by) South African music, brought that sound to his album "Graceland" in 1986. The project became the biggest-selling solo album of his career, and won him a Grammy for Album of the Year. Subscribing to the theory of 'if it ain't broke, don' t fix it,' he delivered "The Rhythm of the Saints" four years later, which was filled with the sounds and styles of Latin America. It featured the Afro-Brazilian superstars Grupo Cultural Olodum, as well as guest appearances and the writing of some of Brazil's most well-known musicians., 7172=This tour, which kicks off February 8, 2014 in Houston, will include both Simon's band as well as Sting's band. Each artist will play alone, and they'll also play together. Beyond that, the set list, stage design and many other secrets are being kept under wraps.}
